title: Simona stood down over gambling allegations
text:
Wests Tigers player Tim Simona stood down by NRL over gambling allegations February 17, 2017 2:03pm @jimmyhooper Source: FOX SPORTS WESTS Tigers player Tim Simona has been stood down indefinitely by the NRL over alleged breaches of the rules relating to gambling. 
The centre, who had been shopped around by the Tigers this summer, will have his registration cancelled if the allegations are proven. 
The NRL issued the following statement this afternoon: “The NRL today issued a notice of intention to cancel the registration of Wests Tigers player Tim Simona,” the statement said. 
“The notice relates to alleged breaches of the rules relating to gambling on NRL matches. 
“Simona will now be prohibited from training or playing with the club until the matter is finalised. 
“He will be given a chance to respond to the allegations before a final determination is made. 
“The NRL will not be commenting further until the matter is resolved.” 
Wests Tigers also sent out a statement confirming Simona was being investigated. 
“Wests Tigers have been made aware that player Tim Simona is currently under investigation by the NRL Integrity Unit in regards to allegations of breaches of the rules relating to gambling on NRL matches,” the club said. 
“The club will be making no further comment until the investigation is complete.”
